ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I gained an incredible fluency in Italian as well as basic vocabulary and grammar.
This class really gives a great basis! You learn basic vocab and grammar but also learn a lot about Italian culture, which is really great.
I began to learn how to speak, read, and write Italian. I learned basic Italian grammar and vocabulary. I was also exposed to Italian music, food, culture, and geography.
I learned basic and conversational Italian, as well as the basic grammar rules and conjugations for both past and present tense.
Good command of basic italian language and grammar for conversation and writing.
Basic knowledge of Italian vocab, grammar, and culture.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments:
Strengths: the textbook is super clear and helpful, the tests are not too challenging, the weekly paragraphs really help build writing ability, and the class is relatively low stress

Weaknesses: there could be more spontaneous speaking in Italian during class

A major strength of this course is the emphasis on learning Italian culture. it makes the class so much more interesting and so much more full to be constantly talking about food, traditions, cultural sites, etc. There is also a language exchange program where we were paired with a student in Italy and that was really fun and allowed additional opportunities to practice. You also get really good and helpful feedback in written assignments and on tests. Professors in the Italian department are so kind and so helpful. A weakness is that they don't really emphasize pronunciation, which can be difficult.

Strengths: meeting and covering new material everyday ensured I was engaged and learning the language, variety of assignments and activities, chances to practice speaking and interact with other students and Deborah
Weaknesses: more opportunities for optional practice and review would have been useful at times

The different ways in which we practice our Italian (writing, reading, speaking, and listening) were varied and as a result we got more practice and a better understanding of the language as a whole which is a strength of the course. It was fast paced but our professor ensured we understood the basics before we moved on to more complex topics that required the knowledge taught before. The course is almost entirely strengths and I can't really think of any weaknesses except that the class tended to run over time and it being a course you take everyday you would imagine the time would be enough.

The strength is that all the grammar and vocab concepts are fit into units that make sense and teach also about the culture of Italy. The weakness was in the monotony of the workbook pages, but they were helpful so it wasn't too bad.
Besides COVID restraints, I thought the course was conducted very well. Access to additional resources and practice opportunities was good.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The online classes worked well, but I thought the breakout rooms were unproductive.
It was really nice having a seminar format in class, and the occasional asynchronous lectures were a nice break from zoom.
Using Zoom worked well for this class
Feedback was excellent, and having digital materials was really helpful as well.
Since it's a language course, the seminar format worked fairly well over zoom.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: YES!!!! Please take Italian! The language is incredibly easy to learn and the culture is wonderful!
Yes! I've taken a few languages at Yale and this is the best intro class I've done! So well organized and a low-stress environment, which is relatively rare for language courses at Yale.

Yes. I truly enjoyed this class and learning Italian, especially with Deborah as my professor. Deborah made the class highly engaging (which was key over Zoom), gave great feedback, and was often clear about the expectations for assignments and the class as a whole.  At the end of this course, I felt like I had made significant progress in learning the language, and I look forward to continuing the language.

It is not an extremely difficult language intro course, so if you want to learn a new language and not completely struggle doing so then taken this course. If you want to learn Italian then there's no reason to hesitate to take this course. It'll be worth it.
Yes, it is a fun and interesting language with a great teacher and organized to help you do well and really learn the language
Anyone interested in learning Italian should take this course.

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: All lessons learned outside of class in the textbook
There were also asynchronous classes, which were nice.
It was a virtual discussion based course that reviewed the material we completed as homework the day before.
none
None
